tool.name: Vizgen Post-processing Tool - Segment Cells
tool.description: Reprocess and refine the single-cell results of MERSCOPE experiments
tool.command: mkdir -p 'input/images' 'output' && ln -s '$input_images' 'input/images/' && ln -s '$input_micron_to_mosaic' 'input/micron_to_mosaic_pixel_transform.csv' && ln -s '$detected_transcripts' 'input/detected_transcripts.csv' && ln -s '$vpt_config' 'input/vpt_config.json' && vpt \ <expand macro="common_args" /> \ run-segmentation \ --segmentation-algorithm 'input/vpt_config.json' \ --input-images 'input/images/' \ --input-micron-to-mosaice 'input/micron_to_mosaic_pixel_transform.csv' \ --output-path 'output/' \ --tile-size $tile_size \ --tile-overlap $tile_overlap \ #if $max_row_group_size: --max-row-group-size $max_row_group_size \ && #end if vpt \ <expand macro="common_args" /> \ partition-transcripts \ --input-boundaries 'output/cellpose2_micron_space.parquet' \ --input-transcripts 'input/detected_transcripts.csv' \ --output-entity-by-gene 'output/cell_by_gene.csv' \ --output-transcripts 'output/detected_transcripts.csv' &&

param.label: Number of pixels for the width and height of each tile
Maximum number of rows in row groups inside output parquet files

section.name: experiment_properties
section.title: Experiment properties
section.help: Specify the z-indexes and z-positions in the data. It is used to apply 2D segmentation to 3D data and calculate distances on the z-axis.

section.name: segmentation_tasks
section.title: Segmentation tasks
section.help: A list of segmentation tasks to perform sequentially. The VPT only supports 9 tasks in a single segmentation algorithm. If more tasks are needed, users are encouraged to run vpt multiple times and combine the segmentation outputs post hoc.

param.label: comma-separated list of z-index images to segment.
param.help: 2D segmentation is applied to all z-layers in the experiment by default without needing to explicitly specify the behavior.

param.label: Model dimensions
param.help: 2D applies the 2D Cellpose model to all z-planes specified in the z_layers list seperately and the results are combined into a 3D output. 3D applies the native-3D Cellpose model to all z-planes specified in the z_layers list.

param.name: diameter
param.label: diameter
param.help: Default 0 value will let Cellpose to automatically estimate the diameter. Too small diameter leads to fragmented cells and Too big one leads to over-merged cells

param.name: flow_threshold
param.label: flow threshold
param.help: Maximum allowed error of the flows for each mask. Increase if cellpose is not returning as many ROIs as you’d expect, and decrease if cellpose is returning too many ill-shaped ROIs

param.name: cellprob_threshold
param.label: cellprobe threshold
param.help: Decrease this threshold if cellpose is not returning as many ROIs as you’d expect. Similarly, increase this threshold if cellpose is returning too ROIs particularly from dim areas.

param.name: minimum_mask_size
param.label: Minimum number of pixels per mask

section.name: task_input_data
section.title: Task input data
section.help: A list of image channels and per-channel pre-processing steps. This allows the application of intensity normalization, down-sampling, and/or blurring before performing cell segmentation.

param.name: filter_size
param.label: tile grid size
param.help: If not specified, 1/8 of image height and width is used

param.name: scale
param.label: downsample
param.help: Reduces the size of the images during segmentation to decrease processing time

param.name: simplification_tol
param.label: simplification tolerance
param.help: The acceptable loss of precision when simplifying cell boundaries. Even a small amount of simplification (2 px) dramatically improves processing time

param.name: smoothing_radius
param.label: smoothing radius
param.help: The size of a smoothing operation comparable to morphologically closing and then opening the cell mask using the same structuring element

param.name: minimum_final_area
param.label: minimum final area
param.help: Minimum area of a polygon to retain the cell. Used to filter spurious detections.

section.name: segmentation_task_fusion
section.title: Segmentation task fusion
section.help: Specify how the geometries produced by each segmentation task should be combined

param.name: min_distance_between_entities
param.label: minimun distance between entities
param.help: When polygons are subtracted from one another, the space between the cells is zero. In order to provide some separation between cells, a minimum distance between these cell can be specified.

param.name: min_final_area
param.label: minimum area
param.help: After polygon subtraction, cells smaller than this threshold will be removed
